column4: The Paycheck Protection Program was highly successful, supporting over 51 million American jobs during this pandemic. It’s time for the Speaker to stop playing politics and get American small businesses the help they need. https://t.co/IWwOdkYktf

Main Street America has taken a beating during the COVID-19 pandemic.
 
Here are some things we can do this Small Business Week, and every week, to keep our favorite local Small Businesses afloat. https://t.co/5gAXSzha1s
In Kirksville, I met with businesses, healthcare, and university officials about the COVID-19 pandemic how together we can reopen and rebuild our economy safely. https://t.co/QGUwBgWKko

I stopped in Kirksville last week to talk to businesses, healthcare, and university officials about how the COVID-19 pandemic has impacted Kirksville. The good news is that we’re on track to reopen safely and get more and more folks back to work. https://t.co/1PCX6BG8OC
When deciding how to get students back in the classroom safely, we should be talking about their health and education, not lawsuits and liability. https://t.co/RMFJbnCgIC

Big thanks to LifeFlight Eagle 1 in Chillicothe for showing me around and talking with me about how the COVID-19 pandemic is impacting them. These folks provide an absolutely essential service to North Missouri and we can’t thank them enough for all the lives they’ve saved. https://t.co/vRYBP2hYtn

Congratulations to Community Hospital-Fairfax on being recognized as a top performer for patient satisfaction by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid. Only 3 Missouri hospitals and 266 hospitals in the country received this honor.
There are no easy answers for educating our children during the COVID-19 pandemic, but a great start is trusting parents to make the best decision for their children.

Some have underlying health conditions that make potential exposure to the COVID-19 virus life-threatening, while others suffer from learning disabilities that make at-home learning next to impossible. Kids who need in-person school should have that available.

If you’ve had COVID-19, one of the best ways you can help others struggling with the virus is by donating convalescent plasma. 

For more: ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/I666LOdU4L

The bottom line is that reopening our economy and getting folks back to work is the only sustainable path forward. We can and are doing that while continuing to take commonsense steps to fight this virus. https://t.co/or6jBHYKe6

The CARES Act was a saving grace for many of our hospitals, but now safely reopening our country is the only sustainable path forward for our hospitals and small businesses alike.  https://t.co/QDsjBki8Zl

The Paycheck Protection Program helped tens of thousands of Missouri small businesses make it through this crisis and helped save nearly 1 million Missouri jobs. Now, we’re reopening and rebuilding our economy while continuing to fight this virus. https://t.co/MUWypAJx2Y

We’ve added 7.5 million jobs in just the last two months; this is a good indication that folks are getting back to work.
 
This is great news, but we still have a long way to go to rebuild our economy and fight this virus. https://t.co/8ASVbG9BE8

We added 4.8 million jobs in June, and another 2.5 million in May. 
 
We’ve had back-to-back months of record-breaking job growth as more and more Americans are getting back to work. 
 
We still have a long way to go, to rebuild our economy and fight off this pandemic. https://t.co/si2PJgGfjZ

ATTENTION SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS: The deadline to apply for the Paycheck Protection Program has been extended!
 
The program offers forgivable loans to small businesses to help keep employees on payroll during the COVID-19 pandemic.
 
More information here: https://t.co/JEuQvgNMlg

ATTENTION SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS: Today is the last day to apply for the Paycheck Protection Program, which provides forgivable loans to small business owners to keep employees on payroll during the COVID-19 pandemic. 

More info here ⬇️⬇️⬇️
https://t.co/JEuQvgNMlg
Some good news for our healthcare providers looking to expand telemedicine here in Missouri. https://t.co/jYYaMyt2Iw
The Economic Development Administration has approved $400,000 to help the Kansas City region recover from the economic devastation wreaked by COVID-19. https://t.co/wrz3v1v8A6
We bent the curve. We slowed the spread of COVID-19. We bought our healthcare workers time. And now, thanks to the leadership of @GovParsonMO, Missouri is back open for business!
Shutdowns and slowdowns meant to slow the spread of COVID-19 hit farmers and ranchers hard. The goods news is that there's help on the way. https://t.co/Vc0Fdjap4B

BIG NEWS: the Treasury Department has proposed a new rule to clarify that fixed-fee direct primary care arrangements, including healthcare sharing ministries, are qualified medical expenses that can be paid out of some tax-deferred medical accounts. https://t.co/iAwc7eyAZu
Thank you to the American farmers for keeping food on all our tables. They don’t stop for anything, even a pandemic.

As Missouri reopens for business, more and more local farmers’ markets are reopening. 
 
If you’re looking for ways to buy food locally to help farmers impacted by COVID-19, take a look at MU-Extension’s Food Finder tool: https://t.co/VAQHlZ2V1C
https://t.co/N1zpD1IKok

We need to get our economy back on track. We need to get people back to work.
 
This virus isn’t going away, no matter how long these shutdowns last.
 
We have to adjust to the new normal and reopen America safely, smartly, and quickly.
https://t.co/5rQIpIhK8u

The application period of the USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) opened today. The USDA will be accepting applications until August 28, 2020. Farmers can find out more at https://t.co/dxCr2Ujtnc or by calling your local FSA office. https://t.co/opAk7mxndG
The USDA opened Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) applications for farmers this morning. You can learn more at https://t.co/dxCr2UB4eK or by calling your local FSA office.
GOOD NEWS: $225 million is on the way to expand COVID-19 testing in rural America and Missouri’s 351 rural health clinics are getting the biggest chunk of that. https://t.co/fNnXtxWi55

To the EMTS, paramedics, nurses, doctors, dispatchers, and other EMS professionals ready to respond at a moment’s notice to save lives, thank you for keeping our communities healthy and safe. https://t.co/QjycUcXldl

While the COVID-19 pandemic has devastated all of America, many were already struggling to get back on their feet in the wake of the Flood of 2019.
 
We’ve got to make sure that disaster victims aren’t hurt a second time due to FEMA’s mistakes. https://t.co/HMOBKnySEP

The USDA has released the details of the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) authorized by the CARES Act to help farmers during this pandemic.

Applications for the program open on May 26. You can find more details about the program here: https://t.co/CXhTawl0Bs https://t.co/QXnEx7ZeeS

The Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) has announced that both Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac will allow homeowners impacted by COVID-19 to defer loan payments and make those payments when the home is sold, refinanced, or at the end of the loan. https://t.co/8i18U7me2e

Earlier this week I hosted another telephone town hall to listen to the issues folks are facing here in North Missouri and learn what we can do to help folks through this pandemic. 
 
It’s time to get Americans back to work and get America back on the road to recovery. https://t.co/p1v4YkAnnl
To our healthcare heroes fighting on the front lines of this pandemic, thank you for keeping us healthy and keeping our communities safe. https://t.co/Lml6jeSllk

DEADLINE TOMORROW (5/13): If you want to get your COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment faster, you must submit your direct deposit information to the IRS by Wednesday at noon.
 
You can check the status of your payment on the official IRS website here.
https://t.co/oeBV3hWaqK

DEADLINE WEDNESDAY: If you want to get your COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment faster, you must submit your direct deposit information to the IRS by Wednesday at noon.

You can check the status of your payment here on the official IRS website.
https://t.co/oeBV3hWaqK
The funding, authorized by the CARES Act, will help families in need with childcare costs and help them put food on the table during this pandemic. https://t.co/M1MeMg648A
Today we pray for the health of our families, the safety of our communities, the well-being of our healthcare workers, and the future of our great nation. https://t.co/XHvGVog99e

On this #NationalNursesDay, we pause to say thank you. Thank you to all our nurses who work to keep us healthy, sacrifice to keep our communities safe, and serve to help America through this pandemic.

On Wednesday, two C-130 Hercules cargo aircraft from the @139AW in St. Joseph will fly over local hospitals in a show of support for our healthcare workers fighting COVID-19. You can get more details here: https://t.co/qqYhIHL3iw https://t.co/sfqth2MCAv

30 million Americans live on the wrong side of the digital divide with no access to internet for telecommuting, distance learning, or telemedicine. This problem needs to be fixed, and it’s even more pressing now during this pandemic. https://t.co/rIEVxBIvVm

North Missouri Together: Scotland County R-1 Elementary Student Council decided to donate all their funds—$1,000—to the Scotland County Memorial Hospital Foundation to help the hospital meet health challenges in the community during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/D7RrbApf8t

Farmers in North Missouri have taken a devastating one-two punch. Last year, we endured record-setting floods. This year, COVID-19 has turned markets on their head. That's why I'm urging the USDA to make assistance to farmers effective, fair, and fast. https://t.co/kudxruCYAL
North Missouri Together: Triumph Foods donated nearly 5,000 pounds of pork products to Second Harvest Community Food Bank to help feed families during this pandemic.

President Trump has invoked the Defense Production Act to order meatpacking plants to stay open during this pandemic. This ensures consumers can still buy meat and it will help stabilize the market for farmers who have been struggling with plummeting livestock prices.
Kansas City International Airport is important for the entire region, and getting this project done on time will help us emerge from this pandemic stronger than before. https://t.co/ecUXvttM8G

The oldest distillery west of the Mississippi—Holladay Distillery in Weston, MO—has produced 10,000 gallons of hand sanitizer, much of which they donated to local hospitals and first responders. https://t.co/DwS2IPyDaT

Four T-38 Talons, Two A-10 Thunderbolts & a B-2 Spirit Stealth Bomber from @WhitemanAR flew over hospitals in the KC area today to salute our healthcare workers, first responders, military personnel, essential workers & volunteers on the frontlines in the fight against COVID-19. https://t.co/xVXtPaN6pk

More help is on the way for our small businesses and rural hospitals. More here⬇️
https://t.co/50ss0pE4NM

The legislation will provide critical resources for our healthcare workers—and get both the Paycheck Protection Program and Economic Injury Disaster Loan Programs back up and running to help small businesses. https://t.co/DVt1PS6Bqh

I just voted to get both the Paycheck Protection and the Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program back up and running and provide critical resources to our hospitals fighting this pandemic. My statement: https://t.co/nvPDtO22Mq

Next week Missouri will start using a new FDA-approved system to decontaminate up to 80,000 masks per day and using a Google-developed tool to help connect healthcare providers to PPE suppliers. https://t.co/IzVLe6Gd1O

There are now 100+ COVID-19 testing sites across the state of Missouri. If you are ill and believe you may have COVID-19, please call the testing site you wish to visit before going to a hospital or testing location.
 
View the interactive map here: https://t.co/pbmq9Vu0fr https://t.co/to8Yws9GnY

EMT Billy Birmingham gave his own life working to save the lives of others. My thoughts and prayers go out to his family and loved ones struggling with this great loss—and to the thousands of first responders fighting on the front lines of this pandemic. https://t.co/MUbwrSwiB9

To those who keep food on the shelves,
 
To those who keep PPE in our hospitals,
 
To those who get everything where it needs to go,
 
#ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving, thank you.
RT @TransportGOP: Watch here📺: Ranking Member @RepSamGraves says thank you #ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving during #COVID19 https://t.co/oGIAg4UnEc
We rely on you to keep food in our stores, to keep critical medical supplies in our hospitals, and get everything where it needs to go—#ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving, thank you. https://t.co/kc8TntsAqa

To all our doctors, nurses, CNAs, pharmacists, EMTS, paramedics, and countless other healthcare professionals and first responders fighting on the front lines of this pandemic—THANK YOU! https://t.co/QqOzmhEPyb

As we continue battling this pandemic, we have to start thinking about how we reopen our economy safely and quickly to help American workers and the American economy get back to work. https://t.co/yXSGwxf4kE

The COVID-19 pandemic brought air travel to a standstill, sending revenues plummeting while bills continue to pile up for airports. I appreciate the FAA moving quickly to help Missouri airports—large and small—weather this storm. https://t.co/IeB4lVwt6V

If you don’t normally file a tax return, you may need to provide the IRS information in order to receive your COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment. 

You can learn more here: https://t.co/BmVZFoo81c

This Easter will be different, but the reason we celebrate has not changed. We should all work to reconnect with our family and friends while maintaining social distance and slowing the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/DCbo9uomdj

While the CARES Act made new resources available to help Americans through the COVID-19 pandemic, scammers will undoubtedly try to take advantage of Missourians trying to access these resources. Please report scams and suspected scams to @AGEricSchmitt’s office at 1-800-392-8222. https://t.co/eprvyGyTy7
Want to know where coronavirus is in Missouri? Here’s a breakdown. https://t.co/JRaQu44ci9
You SHOULD NOT wear surgical masks or N-95 respirators. These critical supplies must be preserved to protect our healthcare workers and first responders. More here: https://t.co/HvTMMEtCpJ

The CDC now recommends that individuals wear cloth face coverings in public, particularly in areas where social distancing is difficult to maintain like pharmacies and drug stores. Here’s a quick video from the Surgeon General on how you can make your own face covering. https://t.co/5AhayUMvN6
If you're a Social Security Recipient, you will receive your COVID-19 economic impact payment automatically. You DO NOT have to file an abbreviated tax return to qualify. https://t.co/ckoNxmkNYB

Many rural hospitals are struggling to keep their doors open, and this coronavirus pandemic has made things even more difficult. We have to get these funds to rural hospitals quickly to ensure they can continue serving as a lifeline for our communities. https://t.co/U4c4MuukZU

Our rural hospitals can't fight this coronavirus pandemic alone. Many we're already struggling before this crisis hit. These critical access hospitals are a lifeline for our rural communities and we need them now more than ever. https://t.co/Wdw4rGTqr2

This coronavirus pandemic has posed unprecedented challenges for workers, families, and small businesses—but Americans have responded with unprecedented patriotism, making sacrifices and working together to get through this. https://t.co/lMGsSP6rIk
Today, on #NationalDoctorsDay, we stop to thank all the physicians who keep us healthy, and all those on the front lines fighting this coronavirus pandemic.

President Trump has extended his social distancing guidelines to slow the spread of coronavirus until April 30th. We all must do our part to slow the spread of this deadly virus. https://t.co/PYDeBSoIcz

She had to shelve her partisan wish list and start negotiating a better deal that will help the American people through this coronavirus outbreak.

I’ve said it once—and I’ll say it again.
 
We have a violence problem in this country, not a gun problem.
 
We need to address the hatred and sickness that drives people to commit these heinous crimes, not punish law-abiding gun owners.
https://t.co/D9uf6uXsAi

There’s a lot to celebrate with the repeal of WOTUS.
 
President Trump listened, he made a promise, and he kept it.
 
We can have clean water and healthy rural economies too—and that’s what repealing #WOTUS gives us.
https://t.co/vC9z7wmXqt
